data.title: Get The Led Out was an Excellent show at a great venue.
data.text: Went to see get the led out last month with family and friends and had a great time. Clean, comfortable venue with courteous staff.

data.title: Great Venue!
data.text: We attended a performance by Get the Led Out, a Led Zeppelin performance group.  We were impressed with the sight lines and the sound.  The seats were actually comfortable with good width and also good leg room spacing.  Also, lots of free parking onsite.  The staff was helpful when ordering our tickets by phone.  We will be returning for performances in the future.  The ticket prices were reasonable. The 1922 stage backdrop hanging in a side lobby originally from the Chandler High School was interesting and well preserved.

data.title: Very nice and clean theatre for performances if not for rock n roll shows
data.text: Generally, a very nice classic old style theatre for performances of various types. This theatre has a very large and deep stage. This is great for theatre, and once i saw an ice skating show on this stage and it was perfect. That being said that despite decent sound it's not a great place for some bands to perform. The band, in this case, Los Lonely Boys, was set up so deep within the stage that even from the front of the theatre, it felt like they were a million miles away, not sure if this is standard set up for bands at this theatre, but it's not a great set up.  Again, i must say it's a very nice theatre with nice employees overall and would go again for other types of performances.

data.title: Elegantly special
data.text: The Chandler City Symphony plays in this chandelier and red carpet auditorium for donation based entertainment. Members of this talented group were invited to perform in China this summer so you know they are worthy of the outing.

data.title: Great Events
data.text: I have been here for concerts, business events and more.  Very accessible, well staffed with friendly and helpful people.

data.title: Boomer's, great time!
data.text: Wonderful shows, comfortable facility and kind staff. We also attended a private event and the facilities was just as accommodating and attentive.

data.title: A wonderful venue - we'll be looking for other events here.
data.text: We attended the Ben Vereen concert at the Chandler Center and were particularly impressed with the facility.  Ample parking, accessible location and easy to get in and out.  The concert was excellent and though the hall probably seats a couple of thousand, it felt more intimate.

data.title: Nice venue with very good acoustics, comfortable seating
data.text: We enjoyed our first performance (Rita Rudner) at Chandler Center for the Arts. I don't imagine any seat in the theater would be bad.  The sound/acoustics are very good.  The seats are very comfortable. The location is ideal.  Downtown Chandler with it's many options for dining, live music, boutiques, art galleries, a microbrewery, is only a 10-15 minute walk.  Chandler Center for the Arts does not serve alcohol.

data.title: Fairly Intimate Mid-Sized Theater with Good Programming
data.text: We saw Lee Ann Womack here, and were lucky to get 3rd row seats for a very reasonable price (I think we payed about $45 for each ticket.) The show was great! The theater is comfortable, and they seem to get some good entertainment. We were greeted nicely, and the ushers were good. A great experience all around.

data.title: High School Concerts Are Held Here
data.text: My grandkids have had their concert here at Chandler Center for the Arts.  It is a great place!!  It is always very clean and the people that work there are always helpful.

data.title: Top rated talent at Chandler Center for the Arts
data.text:
I've been to CCA numerous times over the years and have enjoyed all shows. They have attracted some top-rated talent, such as Joan Rivers, Wayne Newton and Siro-A (America's Got Talent). There are some annual performances (Zoppe Family Circus and the Nutcracker Ballet) and local events such as the Miss Arizona Native American Pageant, which is a cultural treat. Watch for FREE events, such as the excellent Chandler Symphony and concerts sponsored by Intel. 
The theatre has excellent acoustics and sloped seating so all seats are good. I highly recommend you see a performance here in downtown Chandler!

data.title: Always a fun evening!
data.text: My daughter and I attend as many events as we can. There is only one bad seat in the house, closest to the wall, I got a neck ache straining to see the stage. The sound is great and all events we've attend were fun and the tickets are reasonably priced.

data.title: Check out the Zoppe Family Circus
data.text: Our first event at this property was the Zoppe Family Circus. Apparently they come annually and I plan to take it in again next year. Great family entertainment for sure!

data.title: Beautiful Facility
data.text: We saw Gaelic Storm at the Chandler Center for the Arts.  I don't think you could have a better venue for a music group as the acoustics are wonderful.  That being said, we found it very difficult to understand the lead singer with is strong Irish accent.  The music was very good and very fun as most were Irish drinking songs.

data.title: The Nutcracker ballet
data.text: The Chandler Center for the Arts turns out beautiful plays as well as very sad presentations like the Holocaust. The seating is wonderful and everything is done in good taste. The staff are delightful, the bath rooms are beautifully decorated as well as kept clean, and the tickets are easy to purchase!

data.title: Great acoustics!
data.text: This theater has the greatest acoustics of any theater in America! They have upgrade some the original speakers and locations! The lighting has been updated to LED COMPUTER CONTROLLED.

data.title: Cesar Millan Experience
data.text: Enjoyed the Dog Whisperer, learned a few things about dogs. Since its very close to home I will try to see another venue here.

data.title: Very Nice Venue
data.text: This venue is great because it is not too big. That is, you will be able to get a great seat anywhere in the house. They also do a good job of bringing in performances suitable for children.

data.title: A great venue
data.text: Beautiful facility and easy access to the downtown area.  Parking no problemand they always have a display in the gallery.

data.title: Chandler is Corrupt
data.text: Nice place if it was in another city.  It is very hard to go here as it is in Chandler.  Chandler is a very odd city, cops do terrible things to people and the courts make up laws.  Saw a kid get hit by a van and they cited the kid.  Then the kid went to court and the cop did not show but they waited an hour and the judge stilll went ahead without allowing the kid to confront his accuser and the police report said the kid hit the other driver.
